identificationModule.briefTitle: The Effect of Active Nutritional Support On Quality Of Life In Patients With Head And Neck Cancer Receiving Radiotherapy
identificationModule.officialTitle: The Effect of Active Nutritional Support On The Incidence Of Mucositis And Quality Of Life In Patients With Head And Neck Cancer Receiving Radiotherapy

responsibleParty.investigatorTitle: resident doctor at oncology department of Assiut university hospital

descriptionModule.briefSummary: note effect of appropriate nutrition on head and neck cancer patients receiving radiotherapy
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: Head and neck cancer (HNC) is the sixth most common cancer worldwide with more than half a million new cases diagnosed each year . Because of the limitations imposed by the complicated anatomical structure of the head and neck to the operation, radiotherapy (RT) has become the main treatment method for HNC. However, damage to the normal tissue surrounding the tumor is inevitable. The most common manifestations of injury caused by RT are mucositis with the dry mouth, loss of taste, and dysphagia. The severe dysphagia leads to a definitive total impossibility of eating through the mouth in 20-30% of patients. Radiation-induced oral mucositis (RIOM) is a common side effect after radiotherapy (RT) in head and neck cancer (HNC) patients. RIOM patients with severe pain have difficulty in eating, which increases the incidence of malnutrition and affects patients' quality of life and the process of RT.

armGroups.label: control group
armGroups.description: patients of head and neck cancer receiving radiotherapy , who did not receive any nutritional support during radiotherapy

armGroups.label: nutritional support grouped
armGroups.description: patients of head and neck cancer receiving radiotherapy , who receive any nutritional support during radiotherapy whether oral or intravenous like dipeptivine for mucositis
interventionNames: Dietary Supplement: various available nutrition as those contain high protein content as ensure milk

interventions.name: various available nutrition as those contain high protein content as ensure milk
interventions.description: note effect with usually prescribed suitable oral and parenteral nutrition for head and neck cancers receiving radiotherapy

primaryOutcomes.description: Follow up improvement by evaluating weight in kg and height in meters to calculate body mass index in kg / m\^2

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* head and neck cancer patients with age \>18
* Newly diagnosed head and neck cancer patients
* histological proven HNC cancer
* head and neck cancer patients treated with radiotherapy or chemo radiotherapy

Exclusion Criteria:

* Advanced and Metastatic head and neck cancer patients
* head and neck cancer patients treated with chemotherapy only

ipdSharingStatementModule.timeFrame: will be available after two years and used whenever it needed
